intro: Guettarda noumeana, commonly known as the New Caledonia guettarda, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Guettarda noumeana is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
